main event: Four bright lights, bluish green, red, and yellow in color, were observed moving and slowing down over Henniker, New Hampshire on March 27, 1966.
interesting points: The objects appeared to be stars or planets, including Spica, Rigel/Sirius, Jupiter, and Sirius, in the positions indicated at 0300Z.
The objects were moving (2 to 4 apart) and slowing down, but were undoubtedly stars or planets.
The observer saw the objects for a total duration of 6 hours, from 9:45 PM to 5:34 AM.
There were over 100 students from New England College who also witnessed the event.
The observer was the editor of the New England College newspaper and was pulled out of bed to cover the incident.
sighted object: four bright lights, bluish green, red, and yellow in color
witnesses: civilian, over 100 students from New England College
